Class Room

java.lang.Object
game.world.Room
public class Room extends Object
The Room class represents a single location in the game world. Each room contains a name, description, optional ASCII art, exits to other rooms, and may contain an enemy. This class is responsible for storing room data and displaying the room to the player.

    • Room

      public Room(String name, String description)
      Constructs a Room with a name and description.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the room
      description - the description shown to the player

  • Method Details

    • setArt

      public void setArt(String[] art)
      Sets the ASCII art for the room.
      Parameters:
      art - an array of strings representing ASCII art

    • setEnemy

      public void setEnemy(Enemy enemy)
      Assigns an enemy to the room.
      Parameters:
      enemy - the enemy to place in the room

    • hasEnemy

      public boolean hasEnemy()
      Checks whether the room currently has a living enemy.
      Returns:
      true if an enemy exists and is alive, false otherwise

    • getEnemy

      public Enemy getEnemy()
      Returns the enemy in the room.
      Returns:
      the enemy object, or null if none exists

    • defeatEnemy

      public void defeatEnemy()
      Removes the enemy from the room after defeat.

    • addExit

      public void addExit(String direction, int roomIndex)
      Adds an exit in a specified direction leading to another room.
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction of the exit
      roomIndex - the index of the connected room

    • getExit

      public int getExit(String direction)
      Retrieves the room index associated with a given direction.
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction to move
      Returns:
      the connected room index, or -1 if no exit exists

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the name of the room.
      Returns:
      the room name

    • display

      public void display()
      Displays the room's name, description, ASCII art, exits, and available commands to the player.
